meanings.definition: One who forms a mistaken or incorrect idea or belief.
meanings.sent1: The misconceiver believed the Earth was flat.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept to the misconceiver.
meanings.sent3: The misconceiver thought the moon was made of cheese!
meanings.sent4: She was a misconceiver, seeing danger where there was none.
meanings.sent5: The misconceiver's mind was a web of false notions.

meanings.definition: To form a mistaken or incorrect idea or belief.
meanings.sent1: He tends to misconceive situations and jump to conclusions.
meanings.sent2: She misconceived his intentions and got upset.
meanings.sent3: The child misconceived the shadow as a monster under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting was often misconceived by critics.
meanings.sent5: Don't misconceive her silence as agreement; she may just be thinking.
